data.title: Oak Hill, WV Crime Rates and Statistics
data.meta_description: Most accurate 2021 crime rates for Oak Hill, WV. Your chance of being a victim of violent crime in Oak Hill is 1 in 1987 and property crime is 1 in 497. Compare Oak Hill crime data to other cities, states, and neighborhoods in the U.S. on NeighborhoodScout.
data.text:
Oak Hill is safer than the majority of cities, towns, and villages in America (88%) and also has a lower crime rate than 80% of the communities in West Virginia, according to NeighborhoodScout's analysis of FBI crime data. How risky is that? Your chance of becoming a victim in Oak Hill is one in 397 based on the total crime rate (violent and property crimes, combined). In America overall, your chance of becoming a victim of crime is 1 in 43.

Additionally, NeighborhoodScout analyzed all cities and towns in America with a similar population size to Oak Hill, and we found that the crime rate in Oak Hill is one of the lowest in the nation for its size. This means Oak Hill is one of the safest places in America in which to live for its size, a very important finding.

Now let us turn to take a look at how Oak Hill does for violent crimes specifically, and then how it does for property crimes. This is important because the overall crime rate can be further illuminated by understanding if violent crime or property crimes (or both) are the major contributors to the general rate of crime in Oak Hill.

For Oak Hill, NeighborhoodScout found that the violent crime rate is well below the national average for all communities of all population sizes. Violent crimes such as assault, rape, murder and armed robbery happen less often in Oak Hill than in most of America. One's chance of becoming a victim of a violent crime here is one in 1987, which is a violent crime rate of 1 per one thousand inhabitants.

NeighborhoodScout's analysis of property crime reveals that the property crime rate in Oak Hill is below average to all cities and towns in the nation. This means that you are less likely to become a victim of arson, motor vehicle theft, larceny, or burglary in Oak Hill than in most communities in America. Your chance of becoming a victim of property crime if you live here? Just one in 497.
